intro: Erigeron pallidus, commonly known as the paleblue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its pale blue to white flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron pallidus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a species of conservation concern in some areas.
